alert.note: Alert for Grand Forks (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 11:13AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. .Ongoing rises of the Red River of the North are expected over the next few days. At this time, the forecasted crest at Grand Forks is 46.5 feet. This forecast takes into account past precipitation and forecasted precipitation through 7 AM Sunday. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at East Grand Forks. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 46.5 feet, Twelfth St NW road closure assembled. Twelfth St NW closed at River Road. (East Grand Forks) * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 43.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM CDT Saturday was 44.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 46.5 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
